    Grid Search for Integration Window

    grid_search.Rd

    Performs a grid search over a set of values of h.

    grid_search(
  data,
  design_matrix,
  penalty = p,
  workers = 1,
  n_h1 = 5,
  n_h2 = 5,
  h1_prop = c(0.001, 0.25),
  h2_prop = c(0.001, 0.25),
  formula = c(sd ~ mean + c),
  plot = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    data

    A tibble or data.frame to partition

    design_matrix

    A design matrix for the data (see example)

    penalty

    Penalty function for the penalized likelihood, defaults to p

    workers

    Number of parallel workers to use

    n_h1, n_h2

    Number of window sizes to use for h1/h2 if default grid is used.

    h1_prop, h2_prop

    Start and end proportion of the range of the sd for the window sizes.

    formula

    Formula for the Gamma regression

    plot

    Should a plot of the final solution be printed?

    Value

    A tibble of integration windows sorted from highest (best) to lowest (worst) penalized likelihood values.

    Examples

    # Normalize data
design <- model.matrix(~ 0 + factor(rep(1:2, each = 3)))
colnames(design) <- paste0("ng", c(50, 100))

yeast_norm <- yeast %>%
  psrn("identifier") %>%
  # Take ~half the data to reduce running time of example
  dplyr::sample_frac(.4)
yeast_norm %>%
  calculate_mean_sd_trends(design) %>%
  grid_search(design, n_h1 = 2, n_h2 = 2)
#> ✖ Partition converged to a single cluster
#> Breaking and returning single partition
#> ! Try a different window size; ignore if part of windows size estimation

#> # A tibble: 4 × 5
#>        h1      h2 formula        s clustered_data       
#>     <dbl>   <dbl> <list>     <dbl> <list>               
#> 1 0.00521 0.00521 <formula>   22.5 <spc_tbl_ [894 × 11]>
#> 2 0.00521 1.30    <formula>  -97.5 <spc_tbl_ [894 × 11]>
#> 3 1.30    0.00521 <formula> -167.  <spc_tbl_ [894 × 11]>
#> 4 1.30    1.30    <formula> -297.  <spc_tbl_ [894 × 11]>
